timings: Open during pilgrimage season (spring to autumn); temple access requires trekking; exact daily opening & closing hours Not documented
entry_fee: No general entry fee; charges for trek/pony/palanquin transport etc. as applicable
best_time: May-June and September-October (before heavy snow / monsoon; good weather/trek conditions)
nearest_bus: Hanuman Chatti (base for trek) / Janki Chatti / Uttarkashi town
nearest_airport: Dehradun’s Jolly Grant Airport (approx. Not documented)
accessibility: Trek route from Hanuman Chatti / Janki Chatti; steep path; not wheelchair-friendly; horses/palanquins available part-way

timings: Open to public only during specified season (from Akshaya Tritiya in April to Kartik Purnima in November) due to snow / weather closures
best_time: April/May to October/November (pilgrimage season; good weather)
nearest_railway: Not documented (nearest big railheads are at Rishikesh / Dehradun / Haridwar etc.)
nearest_bus: Gaurikund (base for trek) / other local bus service points
accessibility: Trek of ~16-18 km from Gaurikund or up by pony/palanquin/helicopter; steep and high altitude; not wheelchair-friendly

category: Hill Station / Lake tourism / Scenic Town
timings: For specific attractions around Nainital (cable car, boating etc.) there are timings; but for town general area open all day
entry_fee: Some attractions like ropeway / cable car have charges; general town entry is free
best_time: March-June, September-December (pleasant temperature; avoid heavy monsoon; views clear)
nearest_bus: Nainital Bus Stand (approx. central town) / Haldwani bus services
nearest_airport: Pantnagar Airport (approx. ~70-80 km) / Dehradun Airport more distant
accessibility: Roads leading up are well developed; steep local roads; many viewpoints accessible by road; inner steep paths; limited wheelchair-friendly zones in town centre; boating etc. may require walking steps

category: Hill Station / Scenic Town / Colonial Era Tourism
timings: Town open year-round; some specific sites have their own visiting hours; exact opening/closing times vary and many are seasonal / weather-dependent
entry_fee: For specific attractions (e.g., cable car, some parks, falls) there are fees; general town entry is free
best_time: March-June, September-October (pleasant weather; clear skies; avoid monsoon and heavy winter cold)
nearest_bus: Mussoorie Bus Stand (in town) / Dehradun bus stand for longer buses
accessibility: Roads well-paved; local steep roads; walking required at many viewpoints; not fully wheelchair-friendly in hilly areas; reaches snowfall in winter may block some roads

category: Wildlife Sanctuary / National Park / Eco-Tourism / Tiger Reserve
timings: Safari-visiting months are generally October to June (park closed or limited in monsoon) — specific safari hours (morning/evening slots)
entry_fee: Fees for permits / safari jeeps / night stays etc.; rates vary by zone and seat type
best_time: November to June (dry season; good wildlife sightings; avoid monsoon rains)
nearest_railway: Ramnagar Railway Station (approx. close to park entrance)
nearest_bus: Ramnagar Bus Stand / road connections from nearby towns
nearest_airport: Pantnagar / Dehradun / Lucknow depending on which zone
accessibility: Park roads maintained; safari tracks can be rough; walking in some bush; not wheelchair-friendly in core forest zones; lodging requires travel from entry gates
official_website: Uttarakhand Tourism / Corbett Park official site pages

category: Hill Station / Ski Destination / Scenic / Trekking Base
timings: Ski season & ropeway operational season; many facilities open seasonally; exact timings Not documented fully
entry_fee: Ropeway fees / ski-equipment / slope access may have charges; general hill station access free
best_time: Winter (December-February) for skiing; April-June for summer visuals; September-October for post-monsoon clarity of views
nearest_bus: Joshimath bus services (base) / local bus stands
nearest_airport: Jolly Grant Airport, Dehradun (for many visitors) / Dehradun / some regional airfields
accessibility: Steep mountain roads; for snow & ski, special infrastructure; intermediate trekking possible; not friendly for wheelchairs on many slopes; ropeways help accessibility for some spots

category: Eco-Tourism / Wildflower Valley / Trekking / UNESCO World Heritage Site
timings: Opens seasonally (usually June to September) when wildflowers bloom; rest of year trails/valley closed or difficult due to snow/rainfall
entry_fee: Park permit / trek permit charges; fees apply for guides / entry
best_time: June to early September (flower bloom season; good weather); avoid heavy rains or snow blockage
nearest_airport: Dehradun / Jolly Grant or regionally accessible
accessibility: Trek from base (Govindghat) over several days; high altitude; rough trails; not wheelchair-friendly; porters / guides needed; basic shelters on route
official_website: Uttarakhand Tourism page for Valley of Flowers

timings: Open during Char Dham season (usually April / May to October / November); temple may have designated darshan timings; outside season closed due to snow / weather
entry_fee: No general entry fee for temple; charges for accommodation / lodging; sometimes optional offerings
best_time: May to June, September to October (pleasant weather; during pilgrimage season; avoid monsoon heavy rain and winter snow blockages)
nearest_railway: Not documented (nearest railheads are remote / multiple transit points)
nearest_bus: Badrinath Bus Stand (local) / upstream pilgrimage bus network
nearest_airport: Jolly Grant Airport, Dehradun (for many pilgrimage traffic) / regionally closer helipads in some years
accessibility: Mountain roads leading up; altitude ~3,300m; roads are steep & winding; limited wheelchair access; certain sections may require walking on steep slopes; pilgrims often use palanquins / helicopters in some cases

best_time: April–June, September–October (pleasant climate, clear river flow)
accessibility: Reachable by road till Munsiyari, trekking required for certain viewpoints; not wheelchair-friendly

best_time: May–June & September–October (before heavy snowfall, after monsoons)
accessibility: Good road connectivity till Bageshwar; trekking required to reach upper valleys; not wheelchair-friendly

best_time: May–October (after snow melts, before winter closure)
nearest_bus: Badrinath Bus Stand (~2 km to Mana village, then 6 km trek)
accessibility: Motorable road to Mana village is available. From there, it is a 6 km trek to the falls.

entry_fee: Free (trekking package costs vary, ₹2000–₹5000 per trek)

timings: Open year-round (trekking route access varies by season)

best_time: July–October (lush greenery, waterfall in full flow)
